# Zero Knowledge Protocol experiments in Rust

An introductory exploration of Zero-Knowledge Protocols using zk-SNARK circuits.

* The example at [zksnarks_circuit.rs](examples/zksnarks_circuit.rs) demonstrates how to generate an encoded base64 token containing all the necessary information for a verifier to perform a ZK verification.

 Example token with the ZK proof and the verifying key as Base64:
 
```
i76D30QA6joeJvJX/Q9P/7QiTkMrzM4bielXz5DV25D3Sr3/2RS8S3+Lq4uiAJqIoLToFhf6b1e1doCj+ovKDJQkieYqju/cJ38fyxWimKvHYDXcZOv3z5P0LJ0lT75gA66EMpuFlewV84CnWvVXIDhYp+QngNP6XFGqTZ1ZHDGisTCMu4FWWArB5uSTYZjciiGGSekZgJ6DcOkX3gRoc1MReHY3nZTSQVoYZHgCTgDFp9e2a1FkXR7t+8ShfHuK.
``` 

The implementation leverages the [bellman](https://github.com/zkcrypto/bellman) crate to represent circuit computations and the [pairing](https://github.com/zkcrypto/pairing) crate for constructing pairing-friendly elliptic curves.
